BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: HAITIAN NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER SANT LA INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE HAITIAN NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER SANT LA'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER, STRENGHTEN AND UPLIFT SOUTH FLORIDA'S HAITIAN COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE HAITIAN NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER SANT LA'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER, STRENGHTEN AND UPLIFT SOUTH FLORIDA'S HAITIAN COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: See Part III, Ln 4a statement * * * * * * * * * *** AGENCY STATS EMPLOYMENT ASSITANCE 1,138 job seekers increased their employability options with resume preparation, online applications, employability orientation, referrals to training programs and job placements. 393 clients participated in tech literacy training. 390 clients were assisted with re-employment benefits filing or issues correspondence. 446 unemployment claims were successfully processed. HEALTH & FOOD SECURITY 1,668 clients gained health insurance through Medicaid & Florida KidCare. 160 with health coverage through the Affordable Care Act. 1,670 families accessed Food Assistance. 2,891 clients benefited from meals distributed. FINANCIAL CAPABILITIES 953 clients increased their financial capabilities through free tax preparation, financial coaching, consumer credit reduction, resolution of identity theft, and home-buyer education. CORNERSTONE SERVICES 2,233 individuals were served through our cornerstone services, including information/ referral, care coordination, review of correspondence and naturalization/ passport and voter registration. 1,209 clients received assistance with Temporary Status and/or related applications. 241 clients received emergency rental assistance. STRENGTHENING FAMILIES 1,523 visits for EDEN Place services through educational workshops, coaching, counseling, child behavior support and school advocacy 1,029 family visits for mental health services. 100 students participated in our after-school youth enrichment program 59 families fostered strong parent-child relationships through our parenting program. 316 elders participated in programing and activities for seniors. *

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD DESIGNATED ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO FUND ANY PROJECTS AT THE DISCRETION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

THE ORGANIZATION STAFF IDENTIFY AND INTERVIEW CLIENTS IN NEED. CLIENTS IN NEED ARE ALSO REFERRED TO THE AGENCY BY COMMUNITY LEADERS AND COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL PLACES OF WORSHIP. ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO SELECTED CLIENTS IN NEED ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.
ORGANIZATION PROCESS TO REVIEW FORM 990 - A COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING BODY FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING.

ENFORCEMENT OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY - THE ORGANIZATION UTLIZES A DISCLOSURE FORM REQUIRING DIRECTORS AND STAFF TO DISCLOSE POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST IN WRITING. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO MONITORS AND ENFOCES COMPLIANCE WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THROUGH BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETINGS AND OTHER OPPORTUNITIES FOR EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION.

COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR - THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SETS THE SALARY OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS ANNUALLY. THE PROCESS INCLUDES PERFORMANCE EVALUATION OF SAID DIRECTOR AND OFFICIALS, AND COMPARABILITY ANALYSIS WITH SIMILAR LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS. THE PROCESS AND DECISIONS ARE DOCUMENTED.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS DISCLOSURE EXPLANATION - THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
